Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: XKM Oracle External Table COMPONENT VERSION: 12.1.2.0.0 AUTHOR: Oracle COMPATIBILITY: ODI 12.1.2.0.0 or above
DESCRIPTION: This KM used for create Oracle External Table and dependent Oracle Directories on-demand.
1. If CREATE_DIRECTORY is set to true then make sure that all necessary file access permissions have been granted.
2. In ODI 12.1.2 the ACCESS_PARAMETERS, SQL_DIRECTORIES and DIR_DATA_FILES options had to be wrapped with /%% and %%/ but in ODI 12.1.3 and above there is no need to use it.
3. If SQL_DEFAULT_DIR has been configured and Access parameters BADFILE,LOGFILE are using the same directory then you can specify just the file names e.g.: BADFILE 'X_FMR2D_PAY.dat' LOGFILE 'X_FMR2D_PAY.log'
4. If SQL_DEFAULT_DIR has been configured and DIR_DATA_FILES will be using the same directory then for DIR_DATA_FILES only filenames can be used e.g.: 'data1.dat','data2.dat',ANOTHER_DIR:'data3.dat'
5. To list multiple directories for SQL_DIRECTORIES they need to be separated by a comma e.g.: TMP_DIR: /data/tmp, DATA_DIR:/data/data,
6. For DIR_DATA_FILES you can specify multiple files but they have to be separated with a comma e.g.: TMP_DIR:'data1.dat',DATA_DIR:'data2.dat'
7. ACCESS_PARAMETERS : When you create an external table of a particular type, you can specify access parameters to modify the default behavior of the access driver. Each access driver has its own syntax for access parameters. Please refer to database documentation for the details.
Option to create the External Table (TRUE) or use an existing one (FALSE).
Option to create directory object (TRUE) or use an existing one (FALSE).
Describes the external data source and implements the type of external table that was specified.
Specifies the default directory for files that are read or written by external tables.
Specifies the list of directories and their folder paths for storing input and output files.
Name of the data files to be used.
Create external table (XKM Oracle External Table)
Drop external table (XKM Oracle External Table)
